channel.title: Iphone on PR
channel.description: Recent content in Iphone on PR

item.title: Developing iOS application for salesforce [How to]
item.description: Here are the collection of snippets to do CRUD operation with ZKSforce (Force.com toolkit for iOS). Remember this is a SOAP based API, there is a new alternative library available from salesforce called MobileSDK for iOS.

item.title: iCloud Gotchas
item.description: Integrating iCloud with core data was easy when I found this tutorial, but I ran into few issues while implementing and testing it on devices.

item.title: Distribute your iPhone/iPad adhoc builds Over The Air using Dropbox
item.description: Update: I recently found this site called diawi.com which allows you to distribute the app similar to file-sharing sites, drag and drop ipa file and share the link to the testers.

item.title: Enter into / Exit from Recovery mode for iPhone
item.description: Yes, every post you come across suggest the same thing, hold your power button and home button for X seconds. Though it is true, unfortunately I had a couple of situations my iphone doesn’t respond to the key combinations.

item.title: Capture screenshot of the app with iPad simulator
item.description: Until recently I was not aware of the shortcut Ctrl + Cmd + C It captures the complete content of the iPad simulator to the clipboard, You can save it to a file by File -> New from Clipboard with preview.

item.title: Advanced iPhone Development - iTunesU
item.description: Recent search on iTunes listed the Madison Area Technical College classes on iPhone development by Dr. Brad Larson Session on OpenGL ES 2.

item.title: Apple Sep 1, 2010 Event under 3 min
item.description: Youtube link Content requires Javascript to be enabled. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-24euRgImPg p.noscript{ background-color: #fefea0; border-left: 4px solid #fea0a0; padding: 0 0.

item.title: Call Me A Hypocrite: My take on Apple Event Sep 1, 2010 - Part II
item.description: iTunes 10 Another iTunes upgrade, I don’t want to see another 100Mb iTunes upgrade till next month. Many people were fighting over the icon, Guys!

item.title: Call Me A Hypocrite: My take on Apple Event Sep 1, 2010 - Part I
item.description: Only yesterday I got a chance to view the Keynote video. You can also download the video from iTunes for Free.

item.title: iPad - Safari background texture
item.description: TL;DR Apple version of the texture background_linen.png Ever since I installed the iOS 3.2 SDK I was in love with the iPad/Safari background fabric texture.

item.title: Angry Birds – I give up
item.description: Angry Birds is one great app in Apple App Store that worth every penny (Full version is only $0.99)

item.title: WWDC 2010 - iPhone 4
item.description: iPad didn’t replace common tasks. Steve was referring his notepad on stage:). Old habits die hard. Steve can still memorize 24 countries and repeat them in the same order.

item.title: Download Apple WWDC Keynote videos
item.description: I was always disappointed with Apple Keynote pages. It allows you to stream and watch the videos with QuickTime which is not great for streaming and videos are not HTML5 yet.

item.title: iPad - My Experience
item.description: Warning: My observations are biased as I’m not an Apple Fanboy, at least right now (was one in the past, I both respect and hate Apple & Microsoft)

item.title: Solving Read-Only Notes.app issue
item.description: Notes.app of miPhone was not allowing me to save any new notes. This was after restoring the manual backup of notes.

item.title: [BEROR]Code Sign error: Provisioning profile '579ACFD8-827A-4325-F623-DB8CDD5081DB' can't be found
item.description: Check dependencies Code Sign error: Provisioning profile [BEROR]Code Sign error: Provisioning profile ‘579ACFD8-827A-4325-F623-DB8CDD5081DB’ can’t be found Anyone who is relatively new to iPhone development could easily identify this issue is related to the invalid provisioning profile.

item.title: Why AppStore submission process sucks!
item.description: They only check the binary to see if they use any private API nothing other than that. Sometimes they reject the app and give you a reason that it doesn’t fit with their HIG standards.

item.title: iPhone – Accessibility
item.description:
What if iPhone provides an accessibility option for users with bigger finger?
I found that pinch to zoom and screenshot capturing can be considered as good photo cropping tool.

item.title: Objective-C Crash Course for Web Developers
item.description: Please find the below presentation which explains obj-c for web developers (js/php). This is taken from SXSW’10. I’m also searching for the video will share if I come across any.

item.title: Weird issue with application icons on iPhone dashboard
item.description: Note: Apple reported this as fixed in version 3.1 and above. The screenshot above was taken with an iPhone OS 3.

item.title: Sync Contacts from your Nokia to iPhone without outlook
item.description: It is possible to sync your contacts to your iPhone without MS Outlook? Yes. Steps Export your phonebook to CSV Import the same to your Gmail account Sync contacts from your Google account with iTunes.

item.title: How to test your iPhone applications with iPad simulator?
item.description: iPad can run most of the iPhone (iPod touch) applications. After installing the iPhone SDK 3.2 open your iPhone simulator and select below from the menu

item.title: First iPad program
item.description: I managed to install iPhone SDK 3.2 beta today. I installed it on my Snow Leopard 1.6 (Note: the minimum requirement of iPhone SDK 3.

item.title: iPhone SDK 3.2 beta for $29
item.description: I’m little surprised to know that the new iPhone SDK 3.2 beta requires 10.6.2 (Snow Leopard). And, no SDK for 1.
